data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
Musical: Bat Boy

Music: Laurence O’Keefe

Lyrics: Laurence O’Keefe

Book: Keythe Farley & Brian Flemming

Premise (per Wikipedia): “based on a June 23, 1992 Weekly World News story about a half-boy, half-bat, dubbed "Bat Boy”, who grew up living in a cave. The book deals with serious themes (such as hypocrisy, acceptance, forgiveness, racism, revenge and scapegoating) but often punctures the most serious moments with slapstick, surrealism, camp-horror and irony.”

Bat Boy ran Off-Broadway in 2001 and later on the West End in 2004. Off-Broadway, it won several awards, including the Lucille Lortel Award for Best Musical and 2 Richard Rodgers Awards.

Check out the album and let us know what you think!

Sneak peek for next week: Catch Me if You Can

What musical would you like to see be Musical of the Week?
